verses.text: How is the gold become dim ! \add how\add* is the most fine gold changed ! the stones of the sanctuary are poured out in the top of every street.
The precious sons of Zion , comparable to fine gold , how are they esteemed as earthen pitchers , the work of the hands of the potter !

Even the sea monsters draw out the breast , they give suck to their young ones : the daughter of my people \add is become\add* cruel , like the ostriches in the wilderness.\f + \fr 4.3 \ft sea…: or, sea calves\f*
The tongue of the sucking child cleaveth to the roof of his mouth for thirst : the young children ask bread , \add and\add* no man breaketh \add it\add* unto them.
They that did feed delicately are desolate in the streets : they that were brought up in scarlet embrace dunghills.

For the punishment of the iniquity of the daughter of my people is greater than the punishment of the sin of Sodom , that was overthrown as in a moment , and no hands stayed on her.\f + \fr 4.6 \ft punishment of the iniquity: or, iniquity\f*
Her Nazarites were purer than snow , they were whiter than milk , they were more ruddy in body than rubies , their polishing \add was\add* of sapphire :

Their visage is blacker than a coal ; they are not known in the streets : their skin cleaveth to their bones ; it is withered , it is become like a stick.\f + \fr 4.8 \ft blacker…: Heb. darker than blackness\f*

\add They that be\add* slain with the sword are better than \add they that be\add* slain with hunger : for these pine away , stricken through for \add want of\add* the fruits of the field.\f + \fr 4.9 \ft pine…: Heb. flow out\f*
The hands of the pitiful women have sodden their own children : they were their meat in the destruction of the daughter of my people.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath accomplished his fury ; he hath poured out his fierce anger , and hath kindled a fire in Zion , and it hath devoured the foundations thereof.
The kings of the earth , and all the inhabitants of the world , would not have believed that the adversary and the enemy should have entered into the gates of Jerusalem. \p
¶ For the sins of her prophets , \add and\add* the iniquities of her priests , that have shed the blood of the just in the midst of her,

They have wandered \add as\add* blind \add men\add* in the streets , they have polluted themselves with blood , so that men could not touch their garments.\f + \fr 4.14 \ft so…: or, in that they could not but touch\f*

They cried unto them, Depart ye; \add it is\add* unclean ; depart , depart , touch not: when they fled away and wandered , they said among the heathen , They shall no more sojourn \add there\add*.\f + \fr 4.15 \ft it…: or, ye polluted\f*

The anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath divided them; he will no more regard them: they respected not the persons of the priests , they favoured not the elders.\f + \fr 4.16 \ft anger: or, face\f*
As for us, our eyes as yet failed for our vain help : in our watching we have watched for a nation \add that\add* could not save \add us\add*.
They hunt our steps , that we cannot go in our streets : our end is near , our days are fulfilled ; for our end is come.
Our persecutors are swifter than the eagles of the heaven : they pursued us upon the mountains , they laid wait for us in the wilderness.
The breath of our nostrils , the anointed of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, was taken in their pits , of whom we said , Under his shadow we shall live among the heathen. \p
¶ Rejoice and be glad , O daughter of Edom , that dwellest in the land of Uz ; the cup also shall pass through unto thee: thou shalt be drunken , and shalt make thyself naked. \p

¶ The punishment of thine iniquity is accomplished , O daughter of Zion ; he will no more carry thee away into captivity : he will visit thine iniquity , O daughter of Edom ; he will discover thy sins.\f + \fr 4.22 \ft The…: or, Thine iniquity\f*\f + \fr 4.22 \ft discover…: or, carry thee captive for thy sins\f*
